SARS-CoV-2 is a highly virulent virus. The original infection distribution in mainland China was found to be 71.45% in patients 30–65 years of age and only 0.35% in patients less than 10 years old.
13 It is easily transmissible, with initial studies finding that each infected person is capable of infecting another 2.2 individuals.
4 The virus is stable on plastic and stainless-steel surfaces for up to 72 h,
14 further enhancing its ability to spread. The relatively long incubation period worsens the situation, as individuals may be asymptomatic carriers for up to two weeks, thereby releasing the virus in their surroundings in a process called ‘viral shedding’.
